metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13163 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An elevation of privilege vulnerability in the kernel mtp usb driver. Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID A-37429972.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13163` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> android kernel only; affects drivers/usb/gadget/f_mtp.c

criterions.comment: linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
